properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 2:46PM EST until February 9 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...SNOW SHOWERS TO AFFECT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE NORTH
CAROLINA MOUNTAINS ALONG THE TENNESSEE BORDER THIS AFTERNOON AND
SATURDAY...

...SNOW SHOWERS WILL ALSO AFFECT NORTHEAST GEORGIA SATURDAY
MORNING...

.Deep cold air remains across the Carolinas and northeast Georgia
through Saturday. Moist, westerly flow will continue to produce
snow showers along the higher elevations this afternoon,
especially along the immediate Tennessee border, before a lull in
activity begins this evening.

Another upper level trough will cross the area Saturday morning
and combine with moisture moving northeast out of the Gulf of the
Mexico. This system will develop snow showers across northeast
Georgia beginning around daybreak and tapering off by noon. Snow
showers will also develop across the higher elevations of the
southern and central North Carolina mountains through the day
Saturday. The combination of accumulating light snow, wet roads,
and temperatures falling below the freezing mark will create
slippery conditions.

* WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional
snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as
35 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected.
Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.

* WHERE...Swain, Haywood and Graham Counties.

* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM EST
this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6
AM Saturday to midnight EST Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT ABOVE 3500 FEET
